DataElement.preferredName: Opioid Agent Parenteral Route of Administration Day Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the number of days related to administration of a class of synthetic chemicals/drugs similar to opiates (opium derivatives) with analgesic properties by some other means than through the gastrointestinal tract: usually through injection, infusion, or implantation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Opioid Agent Parenteral Route of Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to administration of a class of synthetic chemicals/drugs similar to opiates (opium derivatives) with analgesic properties by some other means than through the gastrointestinal tract: usually through injection, infusion, or implantation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A class of synthetic chemicals/drugs similar to opiates (opium derivatives) with analgesic properties.  Due to binding to opiate receptors, opioids mimic opiate activity on neurons, various cells (i.e. lymphocytes), pain suppression and other neurobehavioral activity. (NCI):An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A class of synthetic chemicals/drugs similar to opiates (opium derivatives) with analgesic properties.  Due to binding to opiate receptors, opioids mimic opiate activity on neurons, various cells (i.e. lymphocytes), pain suppression and other neurobehavioral activity. (NCI)
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Property.preferredDefinition: Administration of a substance by some other means than through the gastrointestinal tract: usually through injection, infusion, or implantation. Predominantly, the drug action is systemic, but in some cases, it is confined to local area.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a substance by some means other than through the gastrointestinal tract: usually through injection, infusion, or implantation. Predominantly, the drug action is systemic, but in some cases, it is confined to local area.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
Determining the number or amount of something.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Number of days requiring pare
ReferenceDocuments.description: Number of days requiring parenteral narcotics
